info.title: Oracle Maxymiser REST API
info.description: Oracle Maxymiser REST API makes it possible to access Maxymiser's platform functionality with code. You can use it to manage campaign entities, such as Elements, Variants, Actions and Scripts programmatically. It is built with REST principles in mind and the entities can be reached via resource-oriented URLs. The API makes use of HTTP features like HTTP authentication, verbs and response codes.
info.x-summary: Oracle Maxymiser REST API makes it possible to access Maxymiser's platform functionality with code.

configuration.name: configuration
configuration.description: Either sandbox or production configuration of the site. Production is only supported in GET endpoints.

currency.description: Currency - only applicable to Sales_Amount type of action

multiplier.description: Action value multiplier - applicable only to Sales_Amount type of action; action value is stored as Integer, so the multiplier is used to restore the original values in reports

isPrimary.description: Indicates whether the action is The primary action is included in campaign reports by default; Optional, set to *false* by default. At least one action in a campaign must be primary

scriptContent.description: Content of the JavaScript that captures the action (not applicable to server-side campaigns)

scriptUrl.description: The Script URL contains details about where on the site the script would (not) run (not applicable to server-side campaigns)

scriptUrl.preview.description: Preview URL for the action JavaScript

scriptUrl.includes.description: URL masks for the pages where the action JavaScript should fire

scriptUrl.excludes.description: URL masks for the pages where the action JavaScript not to fire. Excluded URLs have higher priority than the included ones

example.name: Script 1
example.content:
var pageViews = visitor.getData( 'Page viewed' );
console.log( 'Number of page views: ' + pageViews);

campaign-targeting-rules-content.name: request body
campaign-targeting-rules-content.description: An array of conditions under which the campaigns gets generated

conditions.description: A list of conditions which describe the targeted audience

content-targeting-rules-content.name: request body
content-targeting-rules-content.description: List of targeting rules applied to the campaign variants

name.description: Name of a content targeting rule

isEnabled.description: Indicates whether the rule is active. New rules are always created as enabled.

calculateOnce.description: *true* means that the rule is evaluated only once, *false* means that the rule will be evaluated on every campaign view. Defaults to *false* if not specified.

conditions.description: An array of conditions which describe the targeted audience

content.description: An array of element variants to be generated if the conditions are met. Note that if *no* content is specified (empty array or omitted in the request) all variants will be included with weights: 100. If a variant exists for the campaign but is not specified in the request it will be included with a weight of 100. For example, given an element 'Menu' with variants 'Default' and 'Highlighted', in order to target 'Highlighted' only, you must include both variants in the request with weights 0 and 100, respectively.

content.variantId.description: Unique variant identifier of the variant to be displayed if the conditions are met. Must be a valid variant for the campaign.

content.isControl.description: Indicates whether the variant is control. Control variant is used as a baseline for performance tracking in the reports. Defaults to *true* for default variants and to *false* to all others. Must have at least one control variant.

content.weight.description: Weight is used to control the variant generation frequency - the value is specified as a percentage. Must have at least one variant within an element with a weight different from 0.

name.description: Display name of the campaign element

elementId.description: HTML node id attribute to be used for the element's content

url.description: The url contains details about where on the site the element is (not) present (not applicable to server-side campaigns)

url.preview.description: Preview URL for the campaign element

url.includes.description: URL masks for the pages where the campaign element should be located

url.excludes.description: URL masks for the pages where the campaign element should not be located. Excluded URLs have higher priority than the included ones

content.description: HTML content of a campaign variant (not applicable to Default variants and server-side campaigns)

isDefault.description: Indicates whether the variant is the default variant of the element - the original page variant. HTML content cannot be set for Default variants. There can only be one default variant in an element. There must be at least one default variant in an element.

isControl.description: Indicates whether the variant is the control variant of the element. Control variants are used as a baseline for performance tracking in the reports. There can only be one control variant in an element. There must be at least one control variant in an element.

weight.description: Weight is used to control the variant generation frequency - the value is specified as a percentage.

condition.attribute.description: Name of the standard or custom attribute in the condition. A full list of standard attributes names can be found here: EMEA; US

condition.operator.description: Operator to be applied against the values in the condition. Freetext custom attributes work with the 'Is', 'IsNot', and 'Contains' operators. Pre-set ones work with 'Is' and 'IsNot'. A full list of operators which can be applied to standard attributes can be found here: EMEA, US.

content.variantId.description: Unique variant identifier of the variant to be displayed if the conditions are met. Must be a valid variant for the campaign.

content.isControl.description: Indicates whether the variant is control. Control variant is used as a baseline for performance tracking in the reports. Defaults to *true* for default variants and to *false* to all others. Must have at least one control variant.

content.weight.description: Weight is used to control the variant generation frequency - the value is specified as a percentage. Must have at least one variant within an element with a weight different from 0.

get.description: The *Sites* endpoint returns the list of sites according to the access priviligees of the authenticated user.

id.description: Unique identifier of a site
Unique identifier of a site

lastIterationPublishDate.description: Latest production publish date and time in UTC format

put.description: The *Sandbox Publish* endpoint pushes all the changes made with the REST API to the Sandbox server

429.description: Sandbox publish rate limit is exceeded.

get.description: The *Site Actions* endpoint returns the list of all the shared (cross-campaign) actions for a site

id.description: Unique identifier of an action

currency.description: Currency - only applicable to Sales_Amount type of action

multiplier.description: Action value multiplier - applicable only to Sales_Amount type of action; action value is stored as Integer, so the multiplier is used to restore the original values in reports

id.description: Unique identifier of a site script

name.description: Display name of a site script

items.name: Script 1
items.content:

console.log( 'Number of page views: ' + pageViews);

put.description: The *Site Scripts* endpoint updates a site script. You can do partial updates by providing the properties you want to update in the request body. Any properties which are not specified will remain unchanged

id.description: Unique identifier of a site script

name.description: Display name of a site script

example.name: Script 1
example.content:

console.log( 'Number of page views: ' + pageViews);

get.description: The *Custom Attributes* endpoint returns the list of all the published custom attributes for a site

id.description: Unique identifier of a custom attribute

name.description: Display name of a custom attribute

type.description: Either `preset` or `freetext` type of a custom attribute

get.description: The *Campaigns* endpoint returns the collection of all the existing campaigns for a site

id.description: Unique identifier of a campaign

createdAt.description: Creation date and time in UTC format

updatedAt.description: Latest update date and time in UTC format

createdBy.description: Name of the user who has created the campaign

state.description: Campaign's state; new campaigns have it set to *Implementing* by default

publishTo.description: Campaign's target state updated with its publish; possible state transitions: *Implementing* > *Live*, *Live* > *Paused*, *Live* > *NotCollectingData*, *{Any}* > *Stopped*

isServerSide.description: A flag that indicates whether the campaign is a server-side one

post.description: The *Campaigns* endpoint creates a campaign for a site

isServerSide.description: Optional flag that indicates whether the campaign is a server-side one

get.description: The *Campaign Actions* endpoint returns the collection of all the actions associated with a campaign

id.description: Unique identifier of an action

currency.description: Optional currency applicable only to Sales_Amount type of action

multiplier.description: Optional action value multiplier applicable only to Sales_Amount type of action; action value is stored as Integer, so multiplier is used to restore original values in reports

isPrimary.description: Primary action is selected by default in campaign reports

isShared.description: Shared actions are independent of a specific campaign and can be assigned to several campaigns at the same time

scriptContent.description: Optional content of the JavaScript that captures the action (not applicable to server-side campaigns)

scriptUrl.description: The Script URL contains details about where on the site the script would (not) run (not applicable to server-side campaigns)

scriptUrl.preview.description: Preview URL for the action JavaScript

scriptUrl.includes.description: URL masks for the pages where the action JavaScript should fire

scriptUrl.excludes.description: URL masks for the pages where the action JavaScript not to fire. Excluded URLs have higher priority than the included ones

post.description: The *Campaign Actions* endpoint creates a campaign-level action. Unlike site-level actions, which are shared, these belong to the campaign and cannot be associated with other campaigns

id.description: Unique identifier of an action

currency.description: Currency - applicable only to Sales_Amount type of action

multiplier.description: Action value multiplier - applicable only to Sales_Amount type of action; action value is stored as an Integer, so the multiplier is used to restore original values in reports

isPrimary.description: Indicates whether the action is primary. Primary actions are selected and shown in campaign reports by default

isShared.description: Indicates whether the action is shared. Shared actions belong to the site and can be assigned to multiple campaigns

scriptContent.description: Content of the JavaScript that captures the action (not applicable to server-side campaigns)

scriptUrl.description: The Script URL contains details about where on the site the script would (not) run (not applicable to server-side campaigns)

scriptUrl.preview.description: Preview URL for the action JavaScript

scriptUrl.includes.description: URL masks for the pages where the action JavaScript should fire

scriptUrl.excludes.description: URL masks for the pages where the action JavaScript not to fire. Excluded URLs have higher priority than the included ones

put.description: The *Campaign Actions* endpoint allows you to update campaign actions. You can either associate a shared site action with the campaign or update a campaign-specific action. To retrieve available shared actions for a site use _Site Settings_ - _Read Actions_. You can associate a site action by sending a request to this endpoint and providing the action id in the URL. A shared action can be made primary by specifying the *isPrimary* property in the request body. Note that this is the only property you can use in such request. The example below shows how to update a campaign-specific action and its properties. You can do partial update by only specifying particular properties.

currency.description: Currency - applicable only to Sales_Amount type of action

multiplier.description: Action value multiplier - applicable only to Sales_Amount type of action; action value is stored as an Integer, so the multiplier is used to restore original values in reports

isPrimary.description: Indicates whether the action is primary. Primary actions are selected and shown in campaign reports by default

isShared.description: Indicates whether the action is shared. Shared actions belong to the site and can be assigned to multiple campaigns

scriptContent.description: Content of the JavaScript that captures the action (not applicable to server-side campaigns)

scriptUrl.description: The Script URL contains details about where on the site the script would (not) run (not applicable to server-side campaigns)

scriptUrl.preview.description: Preview URL for the action JavaScript

scriptUrl.includes.description: URL masks for the pages where the action JavaScript should fire

scriptUrl.excludes.description: URL masks for the pages where the action JavaScript not to fire. Excluded URLs have higher priority than the included ones

delete.description: The *Campaign Actions* endpoint updates campaign actions by removing a shared site action from the campaign or completely deleting a campaign action (depending on whether the action is shared)

get.description: The *Campaign Targeting Rules* endpoint returns the list of rules under which the campaign would generate. Campaign targeting rules can be used to target the whole campaign to a customer segment which meets the specified conditions.

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign targeting rule

conditions.description: A list of conditions which describe the targeted audience

post.description: The *Campaign Targeting Rules* endpoint creates a list of conditions under which the campaign should be generated (when all the conditions are met at the same time)

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign targeting rule

conditions.description: A list of conditions which describe the targeted audience

delete.description: The *Campaign Targeting Rules* endpoint deletes a rule under which the campaign would generate

put.description: The *Campaign Targeting Rules* endpoint updates a list of conditions under which the campaign should be generated (when all the conditions are met at the same time)

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign targeting rule

conditions.description: A list of conditions which describe the targeted audience

get.description: The *Campaign Scripts* endpoint returns the list of campaign scripts previously added to the campaign (not supported for server-side campaigns)

id.description: Unique identifier of a campaign script

items.name: Script 1
items.content:
var pageViews = visitor.getData( 'Page viewed' );
console.log( 'Number of page views: ' + pageViews);

post.description: The *Campaign Scripts* endpoint creates a script to run within a campaign (not supported for server-side campaigns)

id.description: Unique identifier of a campaign script

example.name: Script 1
example.content:
var pageViews = visitor.getData( 'Page viewed' );
console.log( 'Number of page views: ' + pageViews);

put.description: The *Campaign Scripts* endpoint updates a campaign script. You can do partial updates by providing the properties you want to update in the request body. Any properties which are not specified will remain unchanged

id.description: Unique identifier of a campaign script

example.name: Script 1
example.content:
var pageViews = visitor.getData( 'Page viewed' );
console.log( 'Number of page views: ' + pageViews);

get.description: The *Campaign Element Variants* endpoint returns the collection of all variants within a campaign element

id.description: Unique identifier of a campaign variant

content.description: HTML content of a campaign variant (not applicable to Default variants and server-side campaigns)

isDefault.description: Indicates whether the variant is the default variant of the element - the original page variant. HTML content cannot be set for Default variants. There can only be one default variant in an element. There must be at least one default variant in an element.

isControl.description: Indicates whether the variant is the control variant of the element. Control variants are used as a baseline for performance tracking in the reports. There can only be one control variant in an element. There must be at least one control variant in an element.

weight.description: Weight is used to control the variant generation frequency - the value is specified as a percentage.

post.description: The *Campaign Element Variants* endpoint creates a variant for a specific campaign element

id.description: Unique identifier of a campaign variant

content.description: HTML content of a campaign variant (not applicable to Default variants and server-side campaigns)

isDefault.description: Indicates whether the variant is the default variant of the element - the original page variant. HTML content cannot be set for Default variants. There can only be one default variant in an element. There must be at least one default variant in an element.

isControl.description: Indicates whether the variant is the control variant of the element. Control variants are used as a baseline for performance tracking in the reports. There can only be one control variant in an element. There must be at least one control variant in an element.

weight.description: Weight is used to control the variant generation frequency - the value is specified as a percentage.

put.description: The *Campaign Element Variants* endpoint updates a variant. You can do partial updates by providing the properties you want to update in the request body. Any properties which are not specified will remain unchanged

id.description: Unique identifier of a campaign variant

content.description: HTML content of a campaign variant (not applicable to Default variants and server-side campaigns)

isDefault.description: Indicates whether the variant is the default variant of the element - the original page variant. HTML content cannot be set for Default variants. There can only be one default variant in an element. There must be at least one default variant in an element.

isControl.description: Indicates whether the variant is the control variant of the element. Control variants are used as a baseline for performance tracking in the reports. There can only be one control variant in an element. There must be at least one control variant in an element.

weight.description: Weight is used to control the variant generation frequency - the value is specified as a percentage.

delete.description: The *Campaign Elements* endpoint deletes the variant from the element

get.description: The *Content Targeting Rules* endpoint returns the list of rules under which specific campaign content would generate. Content targeting rules can be used to target specific campaign content to a customer segment which meets the specified conditions. If there are multiple rules, they are executed in the same order as in this list.

id.description: Unique identifier of a content targeting rule

name.description: Name of a content targeting rule

isEnabled.description: Indicated whether the rule is active

calculateOnce.description: *true* means that the rule is evaluated only once, *false* means that the rule will be evaluated on every campaign view

conditions.description: An array of conditions which describe the targeted audience

content.description: An array of element variants to be generated if the conditions are met. Note that if *no* content is specified (empty array or omitted in the request) all variants will be included with weights: 100. If a variant exists for the campaign but is not specified in the request it will be included with a weight of 100. For example, given an element 'Menu' with variants 'Default' and 'Highlighted', in order to target 'Highlighted' only, you must include both variants in the request with weights 0 and 100, respectively.

post.description: The *Content Targeting Rules* endpoint creates a rule within the collections under which specific campaign content would generate. Content targeting rules can be used to target specific campaign content to a customer segment which meets the specified conditions.

id.description: Unique identifier of a content targeting rule

name.description: Name of a content targeting rule

isEnabled.description: Indicates whether the rule is active. New rules are always created as enabled.

calculateOnce.description: *true* means that the rule is evaluated only once, *false* means that the rule will be evaluated on every campaign view. Defaults to *false* if not specified.

conditions.description: An array of conditions which describe the targeted audience

content.description: An array of element variants to be generated if the conditions are met. Note that if *no* content is specified (empty array or omitted in the request) all variants will be included with weights: 100. If a variant exists for the campaign but is not specified in the request it will be included with a weight of 100. For example, given an element 'Menu' with variants 'Default' and 'Highlighted', in order to target 'Highlighted' only, you must include both variants in the request with weights 0 and 100, respectively.

delete.description: The *Content Targeting Rules* endpoint deletes a rule from the content targeting rules collection.

put.description: The *Content Targeting Rules* endpoint updates a rule within the collections under which specific campaign content would generate. Content targeting rules can be used to target specific campaign content to a customer segment which meets the specified conditions.

id.description: Unique identifier of a content targeting rule

name.description: Name of a content targeting rule

isEnabled.description: Indicates whether the rule is active. New rules are always created as enabled.

calculateOnce.description: *true* means that the rule is evaluated only once, *false* means that the rule will be evaluated on every campaign view. Defaults to *false* if not specified.

conditions.description: An array of conditions which describe the targeted audience

content.description: An array of element variants to be generated if the conditions are met. Note that if *no* content is specified (empty array or omitted in the request) all variants will be included with weights: 100. If a variant exists for the campaign but is not specified in the request it will be included with a weight of 100. For example, given an element 'Menu' with variants 'Default' and 'Highlighted', in order to target 'Highlighted' only, you must include both variants in the request with weights 0 and 100, respectively.
